front.title: RTCP XR Report Block for TS Decodability Statistics Metric reporting

postal.street: Graduate School of Media and Governance 5322 Endo

abstract.t: Transport Stream is a standard container format used in the transmission and storage of multimedia data. Unicast/Multicast/Broadcast MPEG-TS over RTP is widely adopted in the IPTV deployment. This document defines an RTCP XR Report Block that allows the reporting of decodability statistics metrics related to transmissions of MPEG-TS over RTP.

section.title: Introduction
section.t:
The European Telecommunications Standards Institute (ETSI) has defined a set of syntax and information consistency tests and resulting indicators recommended for the monitoring of MPEG-2 Transport Streams (TS) . The tests and corresponding indicators are grouped according to priority: First priority - Necessary for de-codability (basic monitoring)
Second priority - Recommended for continuous or periodic monitoring
Third priority - Recommended for application-dependant monitoring

This draft is based on information consistency tests and resulting indicators in the and defines a new block type to augment those defined in for use with Transport Stream (TS) . The new block type supports reporting of the number of each indicator in the first and second priority;third priority indicators are not supported. This new block type can be useful for measuring content stream or TS quality by checking TS header information [ETSI] and identifying the existence, and characterizing the severity, of bitstream packetization problem which may affect users' perception of a service delivered over RTP; it may also be useful for verifying the continued correct operation of an existing system management.

The new report block is in compliance with the monitoring architecture specified in and the Performance Metrics Framework . The metric is applicable to any type of RTP application that uses TS standard format for container of multimedia data, for example MPEG4 TS content over RTP.

section.title: Standards Language
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

section.title: TR 101 290 Decodability Statistics Metric Report Block
section.t:
This block reports decodability statistics metrics beyond the information carried in the standard RTCP packet format. It defines eight metrics based on ETSI TR 101 290. Information is reported about basic monitoring parameters necessary to ensure that the TS can be decoded including: Transport Stream Synchronization Losses
Sync byte errors
Continuity count errors and continuous monitoring parameters including: Transport errors
Program Clock Reference (PCR) errors
PCR repetition errors
PCR discontinuity indicator errors
Presentation Time Stamp (PTS) errors The other parameters are ignored since they are not applied to all the MPEG implentations. For further information on these parameters, see The Decodability Metrics Block has the following format:

section.title: SDP Signaling
section.t:
One new parameter is defined for the report block defined in this document to be used with Session Description Protocol (SDP) using the Augmented Backus-Naur Form (ABNF) . It has the following syntax within the "rtcp-xr" attribute :
rtcp-xr-attrib = "a=rtcp-xr:" [xr-format *(SP xr-format)] CRLF
xr-format = decodability-metrics
decodability-metrics = "decodability-metrics"
Refer to Section 5.1 of RFC 3611 for a detailed description and the full syntax of the "rtcp-xr" attribute.

section.t:
